#Text=Wikinews interviews Joe Schriner , Independent U.S. presidential candidate
#Text=Saturday , April 17 , 2010
#Text=Journalist , counselor , painter , and US 2012 Presidential candidate Joe Schriner of Cleveland , Ohio took some time to discuss his campaign with Wikinews in an interview .
#Text=Schriner previously ran for president in 2000 , 2004 , and 2008 , but failed to gain much traction in the races .
#Text=He announced his candidacy for the 2012 race immediately following the 2008 election .
#Text=Schriner refers to himself as the " Average Joe " candidate , and advocates a pro-life and pro-environmentalist platform .
#Text=He has been the subject of numerous newspaper articles , and has published public policy papers exploring solutions to American issues .
#Text=Wikinews reporter William Saturn‎ talks with Schriner and discusses his campaign .
#Text=Interview

#Text=( ( William Saturn ) ) I was reading the January 2009 article In the 2008 presidential campaign , it was Joe the Plumber . In 2012 , it ’s going to be Joe the Painter from the Star Beacon , and it says that you 're " a former print journalist and addictions counselor who switched to house painting when he felt guided to run for president . " Why did you feel guided to run for president ?
#Text=( ( Joe Schriner ) ) Ok , ‘ Joe the painter ’ …
#Text=While the Star Beacon article was done quite well as a whole , the wording in this part about ‘ the presidency and house painting ’ is a bit too abbreviated , and a bit too disjointed .
#Text=The more accurate version is …
#Text=I have a degree in journalism from Bowling Green State University and have worked for several intermediate sized newspapers in Ohio .

#Text=A ways into this , I changed professions and became a licensed chemical dependency counselor who started one of the first outpatient treatment programs in the Midwest for people who were raised in addictive/dysfunctional families .
#Text=( As an aside , during Campaign 2000 , I told CBS News in Monterey , that :
#Text=“ To heal the country , we have to heal the family . ”

#Text=After working in the chemical dependency field for about eight years , I felt a spiritual prompting – as other people at times feel spiritual promptings to do any number of things – to leave this profession and go out on the road to look for people trying to make a difference when it came to things like healing the family , saving the environment , helping the poor , creating peace ...
#Text=I felt compelled to gather these stories , using my journalism background , then share them with others – with the hopes of planting “ seeds of change . ”
#Text=After a long , considered discernment process , I decided to go on the road and left Cleveland , in 1990 .
#Text=This was the start of an eight-year research period where I logged close to 100,000 miles .
#Text=What I learned was a lot of tremendously creative , common sense solutions to practically all the issues of our day .
#Text=Armed with this , I started to running for president in 1999 , and have been doing it ever since ( four successive election cycles ) .
#Text=In each newspaper interview , each radio show , each speech ...

#Text=I share parts of what I researched with the hopes people will try some of it in their own town , and who knows how far out it will ripple from there . ( I found that running for president is a great way to get a message out .
#Text=And yes , I am indeed trying to win as well .

#Text=Then I could get the information out a lot quicker , and further . ) Now as far as the house painting , because I 'm on the road some six to eight months a year campaigning , it 's logistically quite hard to hold down a counseling or journalism job .
#Text=So , instead , I do some part-time house painting to make ends meet .
#Text=And thus , “ Joe the painter . ”

#Text=Note : As an example , in the heart of Buffalo , I interviewed Dr. Myron Glick who felt his own ' spiritual prompting ' to move his family to inner city Buffalo and start the Jericho Road Health Clinic .
#Text=He uses a minimal sliding fee scale and has seen people from at least 50 different countries ( Buffalo is a port city ) .
#Text=Why ?
#Text=Because he 's Christian , he told me , and it is Jesus Christ ' edict that we help the poor .
#Text=I have shared Dr. Glick 's story all over the country , with the hopes of inspiring other doctors to consider doing some version of the same .
#Text=And each time that happens , I get a component of our healthcare bill passed – and another little kid living below the poverty line gets the medical help they might have otherwise not gotten .
#Text=For more on our healthcare position paper , see or , listen to my “ Fireside Podcast ” on healthcare , and podcasts on other pressing issues of the day , at
